text:
*[Bug 18816] Checks and diffs for <pkg>/demo/*R*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18816>

--- Comment #3 from Kurt Hornik (<mailto:Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at|Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at>) ---
Thanks.  Should be fixed now in the trunk with c87555, using a variant
of your patch.

*[Bug 18825] Improve tools::pkg2HTML accessibility*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18825>

Kurt Hornik (<mailto:Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at|Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
                 CC|                            |Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at

--- Comment #4 from Kurt Hornik (<mailto:Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at|Kurt.Hornik@wu.ac.at>) ---
Thanks.  Should be fixed now in the trunk with c87558, using a variant of your
patch.

For a package, we can infer the language of its Rd files from its DESCRIPTION
Language field (or its absence), unless the field specifies more than one
language.  Currently, we have no way of specifying the language of an
individual Rd file.  So in the dont-really-know cases HTMLcomponents() does not
specify a language.

It would be nice to have a way of indicating the language of an individual Rd
file.  Not sure whether this should be done with Rd markup (in which case back
compatibility is an issue) or e.g. in an Rd comment.  Also not sure whether
there is other meta info we may want to provide ...
